plants.name: Aster amellus
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, known for its vibrant star-shaped flowers that attract pollinators. It typically grows in meadows and grasslands.
plants.funFact: Michaelmas Daisies historically symbolize the arrival of autumn and were named after the Christian feast of Michaelmas on September 29.

plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: An annual plant recognized for its large flower heads and edible seeds. Widely cultivated, sunflowers follow the sun during the day before bloom maturity.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism in their bud stage, turning their heads to follow the sun from east to west daily.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An Australian native ornamental tree with striking orange to red flowers appearing in large clusters, beloved by nectar-feeding birds.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Silky Oak is not an oak but is named for its timber's resemblance to oak wood.

plants.name: Dahlia pinnata
plants.description: A tuberous perennial known for abundant and colorful flowers appearing late summer through autumn, often used in gardens and floral arrangements.
plants.funFact: The dahlia is the national flower of Mexico and was originally classified as a genus of the sunflower family.
